What book is The movie The NeverEnding Story based on?

The movieThe NeverEnding Story is based on the bookDie unendliche Geschichtewritten by  Michael Ende

Die unendliche Geschichte(von A bis Z) 1/1/1979

Bastian lernt das geheimnisvolle Land Phant sien kennen und findet beinahe nicht wieder zurück.

Related books / From the author(s)

Die unendliche Geschichte

written byMichael Ende

1/1/1979

Bastian lernt das geheimnisvolle Land Phant sien kennen und findet beinahe nicht wieder zurück.

The Neverending Story

written byMichael Ende

Published by Penguin - 1/1/1993

Read the book that inspired the classic coming-of-age film before it's back onscreen in select theaters this September! From award-winning German author Michael Ende, The Neverending Story is a classic tale of one boy and the book that magically comes to life. When Bastian happens upon an old book called The Neverending Story, he's swept into the magical world of Fantastica--so much that he finds he has actually become a character in the story! And when he realizes that this mysteriously enchanted world is in great danger, he also discovers that he is the one chosen to save it. Can Bastian overcome the barrier between reality and his imagination in order to save Fantastica? "An instantaneous leap into the magical . . . Energetic, innovative, and perceptive"—The Washington Post "A trumpet blast for the imagination."—Sunday Times

Na Klar! 2 Student's Book (Higher)

written byMichael SpencerandAlan Wesson

Published by Nelson Thornes - 1/1/2005

Don't let them drop German! A major growing concern in schools is the decline in the number of language students and the impact this could have on your department. Which is why we've developed Na klar! - the only course to captivate all your students and help keep German alive in your school!

The Babel Guide to German Fiction in English Translation

written byRay Keenoy, Michael MitchellandMaren Meinhardt

1/1/1997

The Babel Guide is a new way in to the excitement of world fiction with lively original reviews and excerpts of the best books by the writers of Austria, Germany and Switzerland. It includes full listings of all translations published since 1950. A unique introduction to the wealth of fiction in translation. Babel Guides is a new series on contemporary world fiction in English. The Reviews introduce the best, most representative books, with a quotation as a taster. The Database gives useful details on fiction.

The Oxford Companion to Children's Literature

written byDaniel Hahn

Published by Oxford University Press, USA - 3/26/2015

The last thirty years have witnessed one of the most fertile periods in the history of children's books. A fascinating reference guide to the world of children's literature, this volume covers every genre from fairy tales to chapbooks; school stories to science fiction; comics to children's hymns

Did you know that the movie The NeverEnding Story is based on the book Die unendliche Geschichte?

Bastian is a young boy who lives a dreary life being tormented by school bullies. On one such occasion he escapes into a book shop where the old proprieter reveals an ancient story-book to him, which he is warned can be dangerous. Shortly after, he "borrows" the book and begins to read it in the school attic where he is drawn into the mythical land of Fantasia, which desperately needs a hero to save it from destruction.

  • Internet Movie Database:  7.4/10
  • Rotten Tomatoes:  80%
  • Metacritic:  46/100
